p.s: The first quatrain starts by listing up strong parts of the nature brass nor stone, not earth, nor boundless sea (v. 1).
This verse is followed by an Enjamentenjambment, which means that his sentence continues in the second verse.
Right in the beginning he ses the words nor a lot which has ana negative impact on the reader.
Sad mortality o'er-sawys their power means that even a strong stone cannot survievesurvive this strong power.
With a rhetorical question, Shakespeare questions the strength of beauty because how can beauty last forever when a strong stone and a boundless sea cannot even resist the time.
How with this age shall beauty hold a plea, Whose action is not stronger than a flower?(v. 3-4).
Shakespeare compairscompares the beauty with a metapher no stranger than a flower (v. 4).
His intention is to symbolize a flower which is in compassiogcomparison to a stone really weak.
A flower does not survievesurvive long compaired to a stone.
In the first stage a flower symbolizes beauty.
From the outside but over the time, she starts to shrink and does not look as good as in the beginning.
The second quatrain starts wth an metaphor summer's honey breath (v. 5).
Summer and honey are two positive words because it symbolizes something beautiful.
Summer is the start of something fresh it is the start of beauty where everything looks good where no worrysworries are need.
But how can beauty stay for everforever fighting bettlebattle with the time?
Beauty cannotcan not restistresist Against the wrackful siege of batt'ring days (v. 6).
Shakespeare goes on with an otheranother rethoricalrhetorical question When rocks impregnable are not so stout, Nor gates of steel so strong, but time decays? (v. 7-8).
His intention is to point out with an Alliterationalliteration steel so strong that not even a strong gate is strong enough to existsexist forever because the time decays (v. 8).
He compairscompares the rocks and the gate with love and beauty.
Love is ana strong emotion which can notcannot be broken, unless the time is over and ana human being is dead.
The third quatrain starts with three rethoricalrhetorical questions.
Shakespeare is afraid and scared when the timestime comes and takes a way his love.
Jewel is he using as ana symbol for love, because Jewel has a high value as well as love does.
Shall time's best jewel from time's chest lie hid? is the first rethoricalrhetorical question.
What striking, is the next totwo lines are structured with the same words which lead to an anapher.
Both are questend with a rhetorical question Or what strong hand can hold his swift food back?Or who's spoil of beauty can forbid? (v. 12-13).
Shakespeare looks for a solution how the beauty can be hold back.
He tries to figure out ana way where his love and his beauty can be forever.
The couplet gives the final solution.
There is ana way how the beauty of his love can be memoriezedmemorized.
The aumer is to write a peompoem everyone is still able to read after the time of a human being is over.
Unless this miracle have might, that in black ink my love may still stine bright(ll. 13-14).
The sonnet is addresedaddressed to the Youth a young menman, which Shakespeare describes as love My love (v. 14).
To puttput everything in a nutt shellnutshell, the Sonnet 65 is addresedaddressed to the Youth and talked about ending beauty, because it can notcannot lestlast forever.
Time goes on very quitlyquickly and no one is able to stop it.
Unless you write ana poem about your love and the beauty of it at the beauty will ever last on it no matter how fast life will be over.
